Job Description:
Dow Jones seeks a Data Engineer who will be responsible for developing tools and infrastructure to empower our newsrooms with insights and data, enabling brands like The Wall Street Journal, MarketWatch, and Barron’s to expand their use of data.
This role will join the Newsroom Data Platform team who continue to build out a best-in-class platform which helps our newsrooms increase their focus on audiences and what's known about them, making this role an important force in bolstering the newsrooms’ data capacities.
We are looking for a well rounded data engineer who will be primarily responsible for building, enhancing, and maintaining new and current data products which drive audience analytics and insights. This work may include: (1) unlocking new datasets and data assets, (2) creating and maintaining data pipelines, (3) deploying data and insights to editors in the newsroom, and (4) working closely with data scientists to enable the training, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of machine learning models.
As a member of the Newsroom Data Platform team, this role will work closely in collaboration with our data scientists, editors, and strategy leads as we build internal data products for the newsroom. Day-to-day collaboration will happen with other data engineers within the team and Dow Jones’ broader data organization. Importantly, this role will work directly with other engineers, product managers, and program managers who collectively work on our internal data products.
Required experience, knowledge, and skills:
Strong familiarity and experience with ingestion, streaming and batch processing, data infrastructure design, and data analytics.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as top organizational, time management, and documentation skills.
Top-notch understanding of basic statistics and issues surrounding data quality
Experience in building infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from diverse data resources
Experience running and supporting production of enterprise data platforms.
Understanding and experience with relational and non-relational databases.
Experience building data pipelines in AWS (preferred) or GCP.
Proficiency in Scala, Python, Bash, Git, Spark, and SQL.
2 or more years of data engineering experience is preferred, but candidates with less experience in data engineering may be successful depending on their general engineering background and/or relevant work in academic research.
Preferred:
Experience working with digital media content tracking across websites and mobile applications.
Exposure to, or direct experience with, implementing machine learning driven product features or tools.

POSITION TITLE: Applications Engineer (Central America)
POSITION OBJECTIVE: Provides technical expertise and assistance to Clearfield customers and employees to support pre and post sales activities. Provides issue resolution, working with other Clearfield resources, as needed. Identifies and works with Product Development on new or improved product characteristics and/or capabilities through field interactions.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Supports the process of matching customer requirements with appropriate products:
Communicates with sales or directly with customer to identify product application, specifications, and delivery requirements.
Creates and recommends product application specific solutions. Develops product/project demonstrations.
Identify and understand customer applications as they relate to product design.

Provides technical assistance on installation activities relating to FTTx:
Investigates and provides solutions to operational problems effecting product installation and/or performance.
Supports new product introduction by training and other interactions with customers.
Identifies ways to reduce installation and rework costs. Collects and communicates data to enable a root cause analysis. Updates processes to ensure installation improvements and cost reductions become standard process.
Liaison with sales and customer to resolve issues.

Ensure that all documentation related to any work activity, as needed, is documented in a CAS in CRM.

Provide data, from work activities in the field, for technical bulletins and promotional literature.

Five years of progressively responsible technical problem-solving experience.

Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of customers and Clearfield employees.
